Key Arguments: The legislation is unnecessary as existing laws already address speech crimes like defamation and inciting violence.
The bill could be used to shut down lawful discussions on social issues, effectively eradicating political beliefs contrary to the mainstream.
The bill threatens private companies with massive fines, leading to increased censorship.
Definitions in the bill are vague and subjective, potentially weaponizing the legislation against free speech.
There is a lack of trust in leadership to use the bill only for good, given historical precedents of misuse of power.
Notable Quotes: The necessity of this legislation is certainly questionable when speech crimes such as defamation and inciting violence are already outlawed.

This bill has also unsurprisingly chosen the most effective form of censorship – threatening private companies with massive fines if they are caught allowing so-called 'mis/disinformation' on their platforms.
The hope that this bill will be used only for good – when it can so easily be used for unjust censorship – I think is naïve.
